docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 2-- Secretary of State Dean Rusk assured a conference of American Foreign Ministers today that the United States was prepared to provide the necessary political leadership to defeat Communist inroads in the hemisphere.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4--The Administration's plan to penalize all shipowners who transport Soviet-bloc supplies to Cuba is tougher than was at first expected.  disclosed today that the plan, in the form of a four-point program, would be set in motion in...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 4--The Administration's plan to penalize all shipowners who transport Soviet-bloc supplies to Cuba is tougher than was at first expected. disclosed today that the plan, in the form of a four-point program, would be set in motion in two weeks.
docs.abstract: US sets unexpectedly tough penalties, including loss of all US cargoes and of US port privileges, for foreign ships engaged in Cuba-USSR bloc trade; also will bar all US ships from carrying goods to Cuba; details; comment; speculation on implementation of foreign mins conf communique

headline.main: Reprisals for Cuba Trade Tougher Than Expected; TOUGH REPRISALS SET ON CUBA TRADE

docs.lead_paragraph: JOHN GUNTHER'S "A Fragment of Autobiography" is a fiery particle of the modern world's autobiography. Tell ing us how he wrote the "Inside" books, he luckily can't help taking us on another of his careening rides up and down the perilous, populous slopes of that astonishing volcano, contemporary history.

docs.snippet: Two of the most modern and luxurious passenger liners, built at a cost of more than $50,000,000 four years ago, have become such great "loss leaders" that one of the nation's largest subsidized shipping companies can no longer afford them.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7--Chester Bowles, President Kennedy's special adviser on underdeveloped areas, has proposed ending foreign aid to nations that "lack the competence, organization and will" to use it  effectively.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7--Chester Bowles, President Kennedy's special adviser on underdeveloped areas, has proposed ending foreign aid to nations that "lack the competence, organization and will" to use it effectively.
docs.abstract: Bowles disclosed to have proposed ending aid to nations which lack 'competence, orgn and will' to use it effectively; would classify nations on scale of ability to reform and benefit from aid, end certain confused pol commitments and lobbying by pressure groups; other details

headline.main: BOWLES PROPOSES FOREIGN AID LIMIT; Urges End of Help to Areas Unable to Use It Properly --Sets Priority of Need BOWLES BIDS U. S. LIMIT FOREIGN AID
